techmeme.title: Sources: LoanSnap, an AI mortgage startup that raised ~$100M, has been sued by at least seven creditors, including Wells Fargo, and state and federal agencies (TechCrunch)
Amazon details Project PI, which is active in several warehouses and uses computer vision to detect if products are damaged or don't meet buyers' criteria (Emilia David/The Verge)
Instagram confirms it is testing an unskippable ad format with a countdown timer that briefly prevents feed scrolling (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
An internal Google database tracking thousands of privacy and security issues from 2013 to 2018 details a myriad of data management mistakes the company made (Joseph Cox/404 Media)
Q&A with Zoom CEO Eric Yuan on AI features, the AI pitch, video calls, layoffs, LLMs, solving hallucinations, Zoom 6.0, Microsoft Teams, digital twins, and more (Nilay Patel/The Verge)
